column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Finally we come to the best part: the cheese.  Before I went to this place
column2: I would have sworn that you could NOT have TOO MUCH CHEESE!  It just wasn't possible.  I'm here in tearful remorse to confess that I was wrong.  Lou's kitchen cheeseheads put so much cheese into this pizza that it swamps
column6: engulfs the negligible flavors that come from the sauce and dough.  This is death-by-a-thousand-curds and it has made me realize that a good pizza is a subtle blend of tastes and textures from the dough
column8: the sauce and the spices.  It is not a mortar-shell sized plop of Wisconsin over flavorless other ingredients.
